challenge(uint256,bytes,uint8,bytes32,by.custom:security-note: The owner's signature is required to prevent DoS attacks through excessive challenges
challenge(uint256,bytes,uint8,bytes32,by.details: This function allows anyone to challenge a block by providing evidence that it violates Bitcoin consensus rules.      The challenger must provide:      1. The owner's signature to prevent spam      2. The invalid block headers      3. The index of the specific invalid block      4. A valid alternative chain      If the challenge is successful (i.e., the block is proven invalid), the alternative chain is accepted.

params.blockHeaders: Alternative valid chain to replace the invalid one
params.blockHeight: Starting height of the alternative chain
params.r: R component of the owner's signature
params.s: S component of the owner's signature
params.v: Recovery byte of the owner's signature
params.wrongBlockHeaders: Array of block headers containing the invalid block
params.wrong_idx: Index of the invalid block in the wrongBlockHeaders array

constructor.details: Disables initializers to prevent direct initialization of the logic contract.      This is a security measure for upgradeable contracts deployed behind proxies.      The logic contract should only be initialized through the proxy.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

submit_uncheck(uint256,bytes,uint8,bytes.details: This function is used to submit new blocks to the BtcMirror contract.      It verifies the block headers and updates the state accordingly.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

returns._0: true if the block header is valid, false otherwise

challenge(uint256,bytes,uint8,bytes32,by.notice: Challenges a previously submitted block by proving it's invalid, and submit the correct chain.

getBlockHash(uint256).notice: Returns the Bitcoin block hash at a specific height.

getLatestBlockHeight().notice: Returns the height of the current chain tip.

getLatestBlockTime().notice: Returns the timestamp of the current chain tip.

initialize(address,uint256,bytes32,uint2.notice: Initializes the contract.          Tracks Bitcoin starting from a given block. The isTestnet          argument is necessary because the Bitcoin testnet does not          respect the difficulty rules, so we disable block difficulty          checks in order to track it.

isTestnet().notice: Whether we're tracking testnet or mainnet Bitcoin.

periodToTarget(uint256).notice: Difficulty targets in each retargeting period.

submit_uncheck(uint256,bytes,uint8,bytes.notice: Allows the owner to submit a new Bitcoin chain segment.         This function is only callable by the owner.

documentation.text: @notice Emitted whenever the contract accepts a new heaviest chain.

@notice Emitted only after a difficulty retarget, when the contract
         accepts a new heaviest chain with updated difficulty.
@notice Emitted when we reorg out a portion of the chain.
@notice Difficulty targets in each retargeting period.
@notice Whether we're tracking testnet or mainnet Bitcoin.

@notice Initializes the contract.
          Tracks Bitcoin starting from a given block. The isTestnet
          argument is necessary because the Bitcoin testnet does not
          respect the difficulty rules, so we disable block difficulty
          checks in order to track it.
@notice Returns the Bitcoin block hash at a specific height.
@notice Returns the height of the current chain tip.
@notice Returns the timestamp of the current chain tip.

documentation.text:
Submits a new Bitcoin chain segment. Must be heavier (not necessarily
 longer) than the chain rooted at getBlockHash(getLatestBlockHeight()).
